climbs.name: Seven Minutes in Heaven
climbs.fa: Luke Wakefield, Kevin Keith, Bill Cramer and Ben Traxler

content.description: Sweet climbing in a steep left facing corner. A red C-3 cam is good off the ledge and a yellow C-3 cam is helpful after the last bolt but not necessary if you feel good.
content.location: Left side of the Driftwood wall. This is the second to last bolted route

climbs.name: Little Finger
climbs.fa: Sam Boge, Larz, J Bradley, K Keith

content.description: This route is just left of seven minutes of heaven.  Fun, challenging, and interesting climbing past 5 bolts.  A bit exciting to lead, between the first and second bolts.  Crux is in the middle of the climb.
content.location: Just left of seven minutes of heaven.  Currently the farthest left bolted route on the wall.

content.description: this is the far right hand route on the wall.  climb past 3 bolts, then do some crack climbing to the top.  the face climbing is the crux.  nice route!
content.location: far right hand route on the driftwood wall

climbs.name: Body English
climbs.fa: Bill Cramer, Josh Bradley, Kevin Keith

content.description: This bottom 2/3 of this route is fun and steep 5.10 climbing with slightly spicy protection.  The crux is a bolt protected bulge at the top.  The crux bulge is well protected with the bolt, and it is hard to figure out the sequence!  pretty good rock quality, and great movement.
content.protection: 2 bolts, regular rack (include small tcus and #4 camalot),  bolted anchor.
content.location: In the middle of the driftwood wall.  About 30 feet right of:  seven minutes in heaven.  #6 in the guidebook.  Look for a bolt at the bottom and a bolt at the top/bulge.

content.description: This cliff is south/southwest facing and host some very steep climbing for the Dells. Most of the climbing here is mixed with mainly bolt protection and occasional gear.
